Dialogue.name: Cpt. William Carter D0 0
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Private, I need to talk to you.

Dialogue.name: Cpt. William Carter D0 1
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Sir.

Dialogue.name: Cpt. William Carter D0 2
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: I had a doubt about you when I first see you assigned to this squad.

Dialogue.name: Cpt. William Carter D0 4
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: I thought you'll feel out of place, seeing that you can't fight at all.

Dialogue.name: Cpt. William Carter D0 5
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: But I'm glad that you've found a role for yourself and helped out others.

Dialogue.name: Cpt. William Carter D0 6
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Good work, private.

Dialogue.name: Cpt. William Carter D0 7
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Thank you, captain.

Dialogue.name: Cpt. William Carter D1 0
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Hey, private. How's the situation?

Dialogue.name: Cpt. William Carter D1 1
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Bad, sir. Quite a number of people are injured and the supplies are not enough.

Dialogue.name: Cpt. William Carter D1 2
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Hmm...This is not looking good..

Dialogue.name: Cpt. William Carter D1 3
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Captain, are we going to be okay?

Dialogue.name: Cpt. William Carter D1 4
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: I don't know what will happened. But I will go through hell itself if it means it will save us all.

Dialogue.name: Cpt. William Carter D1 5
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Captain....

Dialogue.name: Cpt. William Carter D1 6
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Pft. I'm joking. Anyway, thank you for the report. Don't be discouraged by the situation. Keep your head high.

Dialogue.name: Cpt. William Carter D2 0
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Captain, any news regarding reinforcement?

Dialogue.name: Cpt. William Carter D2 1
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: I'm not picking up any radio activity here so I don't know if there's anyone coming at all.

Dialogue.name: Cpt. William Carter D2 2
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Damn...

Dialogue.name: Cpt. William Carter D2 3
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: I've been trying for a while but I guess we can't expect anything from HQ anytime soon.

Dialogue.name: Cpt. William Carter D2 4
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: In any case, we'll have to defend this place at any cost.

Dialogue.name: Cpt. William Carter D2 5
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Can't we retreat, sir? I don't think there's any point fighting a losing battle.

Dialogue.name: Cpt. William Carter D2 6
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: We definitely can't retreat. Order from above.

Dialogue.name: Cpt. William Carter D2 7
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Even if we're losing this fight, if we all do our part as planned, we'll still win the war.

Dialogue.name: Cpt. William Carter D3 0
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Captain. All night duty's done.

Dialogue.name: Cpt. William Carter D3 1
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Good work. Anything important to report?

Dialogue.name: Cpt. William Carter D3 2
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Aside from our dwindling supply and overwhelming disadvantage, nothing, sir.

Dialogue.name: Cpt. William Carter D3 3
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Good. Tell the cook to ration food carefully and medics take proper rest.

Dialogue.name: Cpt. William Carter D3 4
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: And for you, private. If you're done with your duty. You can retire for tonight.

Dialogue.name: Cpt. William Carter D3 5
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Sir... is it true that we're the sacrifice for the army's plan?

Dialogue.name: Cpt. William Carter D3 6
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: I cannot confirm or deny that. Where did you hear that from?

Dialogue.name: Cpt. William Carter D3 7
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Rumors, sir.

Dialogue.name: Cpt. William Carter D3 8
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Hm. Regardless of what the army planned, I aimed to keep you guys alive.

Dialogue.name: Cpt. William Carter D3 9
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: We're brother in arms. I'll lead you guys through hell and high water.

Dialogue.name: Cpt. William Carter D3 10
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: ....Thank you, captain.

Dialogue.name: Cpt. William Carter D4 0
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Private, lend me your ear.

Dialogue.name: Cpt. William Carter D4 1
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: What is it, sir?

Dialogue.name: Cpt. William Carter D4 2
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: I have good news.

Dialogue.name: Cpt. William Carter D4 3
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Huh?

Dialogue.name: Cpt. William Carter D4 4
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: I've finally picked up radio call from HQ. They said that they're done with their plan.

Dialogue.name: Cpt. William Carter D4 5
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Does that means...

Dialogue.name: Cpt. William Carter D4 6
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Yes. According to intel, the enemy's formation is going to break anytime soon.

Dialogue.name: Cpt. William Carter D4 7
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: That's nice to hear but why are you acting all secretive?

Dialogue.name: Cpt. William Carter D4 8
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: I don't want our troops to celebrate to early, in case the intel is wrong.

Dialogue.name: Cpt. William Carter D4 9
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Keep this a secret. If all's according to the plan, we're going home soon.

Dialogue.name: Cpt. William Carter D4 10
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Understood, sir.

Dialogue.name: Cpt. William Carter E0 0
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: You may leave.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D0 0
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Greetings, soldier. It's late at night, a perfect time for prayer, don't you agree?

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D0 1
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Yes, sir!

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D0 2
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Haha, don't be so stiff. It's relax time so I wouldn't mind some informal conversation.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D0 3
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Understood.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D0 4
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: I don't think we've met before being deployed here. I'm Allen. Allen Baker.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D0 5
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Nice to meet you. Hope we will make it through this together.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D0 6
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: I hope so, sir.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D0 7
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Don't be so negative. If you ever feel unsure of your way forward, you are welcome to come and talk to me.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D0 8
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Thank you, sir.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D1 0
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Greetings. What brings you here?

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D1 1
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: I'm feeling a bit lost with all these commotion going on. I'm not sure if I am doing the right thing.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D1 2
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: What do you mean by that?

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D1 3
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: While I am not good at shooting and I'm taking the supporting role myself.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D1 4
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: I can't help but feel bad for everyone involved in war.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D1 5
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: And why is that?

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D1 6
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Because they are here for various reason.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D1 7
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Some might come here to protect their country. Some might be justfollowing orders.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D1 8
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: When I think about that, I can't help but feel scared of helping our allies kill them.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D1 9
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: They're basically the same as us, but on the other side.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D1 10
Dialogue.Speaker: N{C
Dialogue.Text: You shouldn't overthink things too much. Just think of it that they're doing their jobs and you're doing yours.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D1 11
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: But, sir...

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D1 12
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Stop. It's not our place to judge whether they are good or bad. That is up for God to decide.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D1 13
Dialogue.Speaker: N{C
Dialogue.Text: Our role here is to send them along to God, or else they'll send us to him instead.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D1 14
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Understood, sir...

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D2 0
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Sir, I have a personal question I want to ask you, if you wouldn't mind.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D2 1
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Whether I answer on not depend on the question but sure, you can try asking

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D2 2
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: You mentioned prayer quite a few times before, were you part of the Church or something before?

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D2 3
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Let's just say that I used to be a priest before the war.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D2 4
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Alright. Sorry for prying, I won't ask anymore.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D3 0
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Si vis pacem para bellum. Dulce bellum inexpertis.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D3 1
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Casus Belli. Deus Vult. Inter arma, silent leges...

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D3 2
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: ...Sir?

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D3 3
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Oh, was that too loud? Sorry about that. I was just chanting something for peace of mind.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D3 4
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: So that was a chant, what is it about, sir?

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D3 5
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: It's an ancient latin chant that speak of war.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D3 6
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Wow. Sir, you seem to be knowledgable in this kind of thing.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D3 7
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: When you're a priest and read books provided by the Church, you picked up on a lot of things.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D3 8
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Uh, about the chant earlier, can you tell me what it actually said there?

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D3 9
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: It's something along the line of "If you want peace, prepare for war."

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D3 10
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: "War starts because God wills it.In time of war, law falls silent"

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D3 11
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Hmm, I still don't really understand any of that..

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D3 12
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Someday you will. Someday....

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D4 0
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Hey thre, sorry about what how I acted the day before.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D4 1
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Ah, it's okay, sir. I don't really mind.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D4 2
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: I'm just a little awkward at times too, so it might've been the cause for that.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D4 3
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: It's actually the same here. I haven't talked to anyone much since I joined the military.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D4 4
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: To be honest, sir, you do give off quite aura that make you hard to approach.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D4 5
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Is that so? I'll have to improve myself then. I guess it must've been like this since 'that' happened.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D4 6
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: What's wrong, sir?

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D4 7
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Well, it's just.... Okay, I owe it to you to make it this far so I think you have the rights to know.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D4 8
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Before the war, me and my family were living abroad. Everything was peaceful....until war broke out.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D4 9
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: We tried to escape to somewhere safe, but my wife and daugther was taken away when the army came into the town and sack the church.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D4 10
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: They thought that we've been spying for our home country. I tried talking to them but they just won't listen.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D4 11
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: I was beaten up and left for dead.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D4 12
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Eventhough I somehow managed to survive through that, I never found trace of my family despite my best effort.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D4 13
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: That's why I came back to my hometown and decided join the army to prepare myself to take back my families.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D4 14
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: And here I am, left for dead in the face of the same enemy again. Ironic, isn't it?

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D4 15
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Uh, I don't know what to say, sir. It's a lot to take in.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D4 16
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Ah, darn. Sorry I dragged you into my boring rant. Forget it happened.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D4 17
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: It's not like that, sir. I think that what you're doing is admirable. Fighting for your family, that is.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D4 18
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: I-is that so? Thanks, I guess..

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker D4 19
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: You're welcome, sir.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker E0 0
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: I'll stay here a while longer for prayer. May God bless you.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker S2 0
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Damn, can't believe this is happenning for real...

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker S2 1
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: What happened, sir?

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker S2 2
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: That bastard Garett, he actually went and die before me.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker S2 3
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Always acting cool and composed. He shouldn't be killed this easily...

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker S2 4
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: My condolence, sir...

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker S2 4
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: My condolence, sir...

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Allen Baker S2 5
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: It's okay. We just have to avenge him. That's all we need to do.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D0 0
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Hey, you there.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D0 1
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: M-me?

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D0 2
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Yeah, you. You don't have the look of a soldier. What are you doing here?

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D0 3
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: I-I am doing my best to help around the trench, sir.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D0 4
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Oh, so you're that one guy from the rumor.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D0 5
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Rumor?

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D0 6
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: I've heard that the higher up placed a new recruit who can't shoot gun at all to our squad. Thought he'd be useless in a fight.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D0 7
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Uh...I'm sorry, sir.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D0 8
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Heh, at least you're doing something meaningful rather than wasting bullets trying to kill them.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D0 9
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: I'm Ray. Ray Garrett. Got some deployments under my belt, so if you want to stay alive, you're welcome to ask me for tips.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D0 10
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Understood. Thank you, sir.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D1 0
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Sir, I have something I want to ask you.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D1 1
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Go on.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D1 2
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: About grenade, sir. Is it possible to throw live grenade back?

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D1 3
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: It is.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D1 4
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Then why isn't anyone trying to throw it back? All I'm seeing is that everyone just dive away from it.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D1 5
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Because you probably have less than a second before the thing explode in your face when you pick it up.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D1 6
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Eh? Wh-but how come?

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D1 7
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: You see, once you pulled the pin, grenade will have only a few second before it goes boom.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D1 8
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: And those seconds would probably have been spent flying toward you.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D1 9
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: But still, if it's possible then I want to...

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D1 10
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Yeah, sure. It's possible. If you're feeling lucky or suicidal, you can go for it.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D1 11
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Though I wouldn't recommend wasting your life on that.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D1 12
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: ..... Understood, sir.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D2 0
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Hey, anyone got injured today? I think there should be some, right?

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D2 1
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Yes, sir. We have some amount of injured personnel every day.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D2 2
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Have you treat their wounds yet?

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D2 3
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: I've done what I can during first aid, sir. Though I'll have to leave the rest to our medics.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D2 4
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Did you stop their bleeding and close the wound when you helped them?

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D2 5
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: I did what I can, sir. Though sometimes I don't have time to do so..

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D2 6
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Well, shit.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D2 7
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Is there any problem, sir?

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D2 8
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Most people don't really die from the wound himself. From my experience, they die because their wounds are infected.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D2 9
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: I mean, look at this place. No way it's gonna be clean. Once a wound is infected, you either chop it off or take a lot of meds to kill it.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D2 10
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Oh my god.. what have I done...

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D2 11
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Don't beat yourself over it. Not many people know that either. Just remember to do what I told you next time.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D3 0
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: I have an advice for you, kid.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D3 1
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: What is it, sir?

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D3 2
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: I don't know what kind of situation we might be getting into in the future. But it's always a good idea to trust your gut instinct.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D3 3
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Gut instinct?

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D3 4
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Yeah. It's something that kinda pop up in your head. They are usually one of the best way to survive.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D3 5
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Huh, I think I have that happened to me from time to time too.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D3 6
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Yeah, that. Though you have to think it through carefully first.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D3 7
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Why, if I may ask, sir?

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D3 8
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Well, I did say that it's usually the best. Not the best.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D3 9
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Some of it might even be dumb enough to get you killed. Heh.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D3 10
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: I-I will take that into consideration, sir.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D3 11
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Good. That's what define whether you're green or you're good. Trust your instinct but don't depend on it.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D4 0
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Sir, I have noticed this for a while. What is with that gun you kept there?

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D4 1
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Ah, this? This is my personal gun. Not the one issued by the army.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D4 2
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Wow, sir. It looks really good.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D4 3
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Yeah. Spent a lot of money on it. Though it still function nearly the same as the one we get issued with anyway.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D4 4
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Why did you bring it here, sir?

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D4 5
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: For good luck charm. This is my first gun ever.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D4 6
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: My father was a veteran too an he bought me this to train me how to shoot even before I join the Army.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D4 7
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Your father is a soldier too? Wow, he must've been a great man, seeing that his son is doing really great here.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D4 8
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Was. He died. Kicked the bucket right after I was done with my bootcamp.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D4 9
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Oh.... I'm sorry to hear that.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D4 10
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Don't be. Got himself into something stupid.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett D4 11
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: He's not even killed while he's in duty. Though I am still thankful for him for teaching me all the useful things in this line of work.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett E0 0
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Stay alive out there.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett S1 0
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Damn that stupid bastard..

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett S1 1
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: What's wrong, sir?

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett S1 2
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: That fucker, Allen, he just kicked the bucket today.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett S1 3
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Oh...

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett S1 4
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: That annoying prick always preach me on what to do or what not to do.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett S1 5
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Acting high and mighty, all goody two shoes. Went and got himself killed, damn it...

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Ray Garrett S1 6
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: I'm sorry to hear that, sir....

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Darren Reed D0 0
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Hey there. You're the one who was helping around the trench, right?

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Darren Reed D0 1
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Yes, that's me.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Darren Reed D0 2
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Thank you for the help. We appreciate your assistance.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Darren Reed D0 3
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: My name's Darren. I'm a Combat Medic of this squad.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Darren Reed D0 4
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Nice to meet you, sir.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Darren Reed D0 5
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: No need to be formal, just call me Darren.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Darren Reed D0 6
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Alright, understood.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Darren Reed D0 7
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: If you have time to spare, you can come to medical treatment room.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Darren Reed D0 8
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: We can always use another pair of helping hands.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Darren Reed D0 9
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: I'll keep that in mind.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Darren Reed D1 0
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Damn, these muscle heads. Will it kill them to keep things clean for once?

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Darren Reed D1 1
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: What's the problem?

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Darren Reed D1 2
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Hygiene is a big problem. You see all these dirty stuff? Don't they care about what go into their body at all?

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Darren Reed D1 3
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: I think they don't really put cleanliness at their top priority at the moment...

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Darren Reed D1 4
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: That might be true. But hygiene is a very important thing.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Darren Reed D1 5
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: If things are dirty, even a scratch wound could get you infected and killed you!

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Darren Reed D1 6
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Whoa, seriously? Even a scratch wound can kill??

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Darren Reed D1 7
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: It is. Seriously. Trust my words for it. I've saw it happened more than a few times already.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Darren Reed D1 8
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Ah, I understand now. I'll try to warn them to keep things a bit cleaner from now on.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Darren Reed D1 9
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Thank you. Finally someone who understand.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Darren Reed D2 0
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: I've been wondering for a while, are medics allowed to engage in combat?

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Darren Reed D2 1
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: No, not really

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Darren Reed D2 2
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Eh? Then why're you going out there and shooting?

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Darren Reed D2 3
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Well, better them than us.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Darren Reed D2 4
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Eh? I'm not sure I understand...

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Darren Reed D2 5
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: It means that it's better to kill them than let them kill us.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Darren Reed D2 6
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Won't that be against some sort of rules?

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Darren Reed D2 7
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Something like that. If medics engage in combat willingly, it mean that the medic gave up his protection from the law.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Darren Reed D2 8
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Sound complicated.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Darren Reed D2 9
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: A little, yeah. Don't worry about it though. I'm still doing my job as a medical personnel.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Darren Reed D3 0
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Hey, you. You sure you've been resting properly?

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Darren Reed D3 1
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: I....think I did. Why?

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Darren Reed D3 2
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: You have a face of a dead fish. Most likely from lack of sleep. I can tell, you know?

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Darren Reed D3 3
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Well, it's pretty hard to fall asleep lately...

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Darren Reed D3 4
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Something's on your mind?

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Darren Reed D3 5
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: A lot of things, actually...

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Darren Reed D3 6
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Well, doubt I can really help if it's about the situation we're in. I'm not expert in psychology either.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Darren Reed D3 7
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: For now, I think you should drink some water and do some exercise to tire yourself out. It should help you goto sleep faster.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Darren Reed D3 8
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Thanks, I'll try that.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Darren Reed D4 0
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: This might be a little sudden but why did you decided to be a combat medic?

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Darren Reed D4 1
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Hm? What compelled you to ask that?

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Darren Reed D4 2
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Well, you told me that you'll gladly shoot at the enemies to keep our friends safe.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Darren Reed D4 3
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: And so I thought that you could've joined as a normal soldier instead of a medic.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Darren Reed D4 4
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Ah, so that's the reason. Well, my family is a family of doctor and so I was naturally trained to be one too.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Darren Reed D4 5
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Huh...

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Darren Reed D4 6
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: But I thought that simply waiting for the patient in the office isn't enough.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Darren Reed D4 7
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: There's a lot of people out the who can't make it to the hospital. That's why I decided to come out here instead.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Darren Reed D4 8
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Wow, that's a really respectable decision.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Darren Reed D4 9
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Ironicaly though, I probably killed more people than I had saved by now. Hahaha...

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Darren Reed D4 10
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Uh oh...

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Darren Reed D4 11
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Nah, don't worry about it. I've always known that this is going to happen someday.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Darren Reed D4 12
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Can't really do anything about that now.

Dialogue.name: Cpl. Darren Reed E0 0
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Remember to take care of yourself. You can't help anyone if you're dead.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley D0 0
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: H-hello..

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley D0 1
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Hm? Hello, do you need something?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley D0 2
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: N-no. I just want to thank you for the help..

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley D0 3
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Oh, that. It's okay. Just doing my part.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley D0 4
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Y-you don't have to be humble. I-I am grateful for you help.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley D0 5
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Alright. You're welcome. If you're in trouble, call me over and I'll do anything I can to help.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley D0 6
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: T-thank you. My name is Jason, n-nice to meet you.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley D0 7
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Nice to meet you. Let's give it our best shot.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley D0 8
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Y-yes, let's do our best.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley D1 0
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: H-hello..

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley D1 1
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Ah, hello Jason, do you need something?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley D1 2
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Ah.. I want to thank you... for being nice to me...

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley D1 3
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Eh?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley D1 4
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Other people don't like me... because I'm weak...

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley D1 5
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Oh...

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley D1 6
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: You are the only one who's nice to me... so I want to thank you...

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley D1 7
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Ah.... actually...

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley D1 8
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: I think it's because I'm weak too. I can't shoot gun right at all so I'm useless in a fight.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley D1 9
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: ....is that so?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley D1 10
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Yeah, admittedly. I think I might be acting kind toward you because we're similar...

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley D1 11
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: I see... so we're like kindred spirit here. I'm not alone...

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley D1 12
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Yeah, you're not alone. We'll have to help each other from now on.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley D1 13
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Y-yeah. That's a good idea.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley D1 14
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Yep, so if there's any problem, let's deal with it together

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley D2 0
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Oh, hey there!

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley D2 2
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Uh... are you okay?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley D2 3
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Huh? WHOA?!

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley D2 4
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Whoa, what the hell, man?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley D2 5
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: O-oh, sorry...I-I was lost in thought..

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley D2 6
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: What were you thinking about?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley D2 7
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: J-just about how things are here. D-don't you think it's scary?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley D2 8
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: The sound of explosion... Gunshot... Bullets flying around...People moaning in pain...

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley D2 9
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Yeah... things are really bad here.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley D2 10
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: I don't understand why people need to do this, we could've just sit down and talk things peacefully....

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley D2 11
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: I don't know either.. but now that it come to this, we have to do our part and prevent others from getting involved.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley D2 12
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: .....You're right. I shouldn't be wasting my time thinking about useless things...

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley D2 13
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Don't worry about it. I think we all have to let it out sometimes.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley D2 14
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: T-thank you.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley D3 0
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: H-hey.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley D3 1
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Hi there, something wrong?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley D3 2
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Uh, I just want to tell you something.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley D3 3
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Hm? What is it?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley D3 4
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: I've decided. I'll do my best out there and won't drag any of you guys down anymore.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley D3 5
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Huh... why are you suddenly so ambitious? What happened?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley D3 6
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: You've been helping me and everyone else a lot. I admire and respect your effort.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley D3 7
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: That's why I've decided to do my step up my mentality too.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley D3 8
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: ...I see. In any case, glad to have you.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley D3 9
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Yes. I'll be in your care.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley D4 0
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Hey, once this is all over, what're you going to do?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley D4 1
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Hmm, I don't really know either. Maybe I'll resign and pursue medical path or something...

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley D4 2
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Huh, interesting. I'm not sure what I'll do but I'm thinking about re-enlisting.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley D4 3
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Re-enlist? Never thought you'd do it.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley D4 4
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Yeah, well, I'm still considering it. But I think it's a job worth doing.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley D4 5
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: I see....

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley D4 6
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: In any case, we'll need to pull through this first.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley D4 7
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Yeah.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley E0 0
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: I'm grateful for your help. I'll have to go now, see you later.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Jason Riley E1 0
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Let's do our best tomorrow too!

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Roy Watson D0 1
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: What are you looking at, punk?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Roy Watson D0 2
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Oh, no. Nothing...

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Roy Watson D0 3
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Then mind your own business.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Roy Watson D0 4
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Sorry to bother you..

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Roy Watson D0 5
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: If you know you're bothering me then just scram.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Roy Watson D1 1
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: What? Do you really want to get punched?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Roy Watson D1 2
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: No, not that. Since we're stuck here together, I though we should get to know each other.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Roy Watson D1 3
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Heh, what an honor. Name's Roy. That's all you need to know.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Roy Watson D1 4
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Ah, thank you. Nice to meet you. Hope we can get along.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Roy Watson D1 5
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Piss off.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Roy Watson D2 0
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Hey, Roy.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Roy Watson D2 1
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: What are you up to this time? Didn't I tell you not to bother me?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Roy Watson D2 2
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: I'm just wondering about why you're so agressive. Is there any reason for that?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Roy Watson D2 3
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Tch, stop poking your nose where it doesn't belong.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Roy Watson D2 4
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: I just wanna know the reason so I can avoid it from happening, if possible.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Roy Watson D2 5
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Fine, fine. I was a criminal that got conscripted into the army. So I hate every kind of authority out there. That's it.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Roy Watson D2 6
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: If that's the reason, then I can't really do anything about that. Beside, you're also a soldier like us, why don't you open up a bit?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Roy Watson D2 7
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Beside, you're also a soldier like us, why don't you open up a bit?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Roy Watson D2 8
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Oh, fuck off already.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Roy Watson D3 0
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Hm, what is that knife there?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Roy Watson D3 1
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: This? This is a trench knife. Have had it since forever ago, carried it with me all the time.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Roy Watson D3 2
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: You have this before even joining the army? What would you use it for?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Roy Watson D3 3
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Stabbing people. Duh. What else could a knife like this be used for?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Roy Watson D3 4
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Err.. forget I ask anything then.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Roy Watson D3 5
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Wise decision.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Roy Watson D4 0
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Say, you were jailed and then conscripted into the army, right?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Roy Watson D4 1
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Don't make me repeat myself. What is it this time?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Roy Watson D4 2
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: I wanna know why you'd choose to come out here and risk your life. Isn't the prison safer?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Roy Watson D4 3
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Heh. Do you want to be chained and rot away in the jail then?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Roy Watson D4 4
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: N-no...

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Roy Watson D4 5
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: That's why I am here. I'd rather get ordered around and kill some strangers rather than dying like that in the jail.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Roy Watson D4 6
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Just how long were you sentenced? What on earth did you do?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Roy Watson D4 7
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Somethings are better left not known.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Roy Watson E0 0
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Keep your nose where it belongs and you wouldn't get socked in the face.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Ellis Anderson D0 0
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Hey, there! Youre looking gloomy, what happened?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Ellis Anderson D0 1
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: I'm not good at shooting so I feel like I'm useless here...

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Ellis Anderson D0 2
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Ah, so you were the guy who was lugging things around during the day.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Ellis Anderson D0 3
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Yeah, that was me. That's about all I can do to help.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Ellis Anderson D0 4
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Haha, don't worry about it. You should brigthen up a little.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Ellis Anderson D0 5
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: I'd like to but I don't really know if I should or how to do that...

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Ellis Anderson D0 6
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: I'll let you in on a secret, the best way to relieve stress is to joke about stress itself.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Ellis Anderson D0 8
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Well, you don't have to force yourself. It doesn't have to be right now, you can take your time.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Ellis Anderson D1 0
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Say, you really can't shoot? Like, at all?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Ellis Anderson D1 1
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: I am ashamed to admit it but yes. Never managed to land a shot properly before.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Ellis Anderson D1 2
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Wow, that's actually amazing, in a way.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Ellis Anderson D1 3
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Geez, no need to rub it in.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Ellis Anderson D1 4
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Err, if you never managed to land a shot on your target before.... Have you tried changing the target and see if your stray shot hit your other target?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Ellis Anderson D1 5
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Have you tried changing the target and see if your stray shot hit your other target?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Ellis Anderson D1 6
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Sound good. Doesn't work. Tried that already.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Ellis Anderson D1 7
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Whoa.... Well, don't let it get to you. I'm sure you will be able to do it someday.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Ellis Anderson D1 8
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Not sure if I really want to be able to do that to kill someone.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Ellis Anderson D1 9
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Well....it could come in handy someday.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Ellis Anderson D1 10
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Maybe, though I hope that's not the case.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Ellis Anderson D1 11
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: In any case, you still know how to operate a gun. That's a nice start.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Ellis Anderson D1 12
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Also, if you call everything you hit a target, you will never miss any shot.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Ellis Anderson D1 13
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Gee. Thanks, Captain Obvious.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Ellis Anderson D2 0
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Hey, dude! Look at this!

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Ellis Anderson D2 1
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Uh oh, is that what I think it is?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Ellis Anderson D2 2
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Totally! It's Mister Pineapple!

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Ellis Anderson D2 3
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Mister-what??

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Ellis Anderson D2 4
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Pineapple. Don't you think frag grenade looks like pineapple?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Ellis Anderson D2 5
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: That's new to me, and how'd you get that? I don't think we have that in our standard equipment.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Ellis Anderson D2 6
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Well, the enemy threw it at me but apparently the pin was not pulled.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Ellis Anderson D2 7
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Huh, that's some luck right there.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Ellis Anderson D2 8
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Or maybe the guy who did it was just dumb.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Ellis Anderson D2 9
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Anyway, I'd like to keep it close. Might come in handy.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Ellis Anderson D2 10
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Not sure if this is a good idea....

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Ellis Anderson D2 11
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Well, maybe there will be a good time where I can send Mr.Pineapple back home.... without the pin, of course.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Ellis Anderson D2 12
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: In any case, I'd like to fidget with this a little, talk to you later!

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Ellis Anderson D2 13
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Make sure you don't blow yourself up then.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Ellis Anderson D3 0
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: There sure are a lot of enemies out there, why won't they let up already?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Ellis Anderson D3 1
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: I don't know either..

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Ellis Anderson D3 2
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Well, I just hope that I can make it back home in one piece.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Ellis Anderson D3 3
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Same here...

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Ellis Anderson D3 6
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Hey, man.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Ellis Anderson D3 7
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: What is it?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Ellis Anderson D3 8
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: If I die, can you put 3 pairs of boot on my grave?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Ellis Anderson D3 9
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Uh.....Why?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Ellis Anderson D3 10
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: If you put 3 pairs of boot on my grave when I die...

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Ellis Anderson D3 11
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: You can say that I'll be 6-feet under by then. Hahaha!

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Ellis Anderson D3 12
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Er.. alright. I'll keep that in mind...

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Ellis Anderson D3 13
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Haha, guess it's a bit too early for that kind of joke huh? What a killjoy.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Ellis Anderson D3 14
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Yeah...

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Ellis Anderson E0 0
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: If you ever come up with a spicy joke, lemme know, okay? I'm can always use another good one.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Andrew Summer D0 0
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: ....*scribling*

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Andrew Summer D0 1
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: ...M-Mister?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Andrew Summer D0 2
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Oh, I'm sorry. I'm in a middle of sketching. What's the matter?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Andrew Summer D0 3
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Sketching?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Andrew Summer D0 4
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Oh, I mean I'm drawing something.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Andrew Summer D0 5
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: You can draw!?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Andrew Summer D0 6
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Of course, I do. But I don't really want to talk about it. People often ask me to draw them...for free.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Andrew Summer D0 7
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: But why? You don't like them?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Andrew Summer D0 8
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Well, I would love to, but drawing people is not my expertise. I prefer to draw birds instead.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Andrew Summer D0 9
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Really!? But why birds, I don't see anything...likeable about them.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Andrew Summer D0 10
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: But don't you think they are awesome? They have wings to fly freely in the sky and when they are on their legs, they move in a funny way too.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Andrew Summer D0 11
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: I'll continue my drawing. It's almost finish now. By the way, my name is Andrew. See ya around.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Andrew Summer D0 12
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: See you, Andrew.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Andrew Summer D1 0
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Hi-hi Andrew

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Andrew Summer D1 1
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: ...*scribling* Oh, hi, what is it? *continue scribling*

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Andrew Summer D1 2
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: What are you drawing this time?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Andrew Summer D1 3
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: A bird, it's the one I saw this morning.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Andrew Summer D1 4
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Can you remember it, even after all the shooting in the day!?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Andrew Summer D1 5
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Yeah. The color of the feather, the size of the eye. I could remember them all precisely, all the details..

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Andrew Summer D1 6
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: That's amazing! How could you remember all of that?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Andrew Summer D1 7
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: I just...dang it, what's the shade of its wing...

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Andrew Summer D1 8
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Andrew...

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Andrew Summer D2 0
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Hi, Andrew. Drawing a bird again today?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Andrew Summer D2 1
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: It's..finished now. And about yesterday, you asked me how I remember about the bird, right?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Andrew Summer D2 2
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Yes, I suppose...

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Andrew Summer D2 3
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Well, I have never told anyone abot this. I used to watch them alot when I was a little, same as your age.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Andrew Summer D2 4
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: My father usually took me with him when he was hunting a bird, and he went for it everyday.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Andrew Summer D2 5
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: "We need to sell it to make a living" He always said that, but I can't take myself to watch these little things died.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Andrew Summer D2 6
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: I insisted that I will just keep them instead, so he took me to his friend who was a painter and told me that "You can keep it in a paper instead"

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Andrew Summer D2 7
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: I was really fasinated that day and from then, I visited his friend everyday to learn drawing from him.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Andrew Summer D2 8
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: But he was a painter, so why are you drawing then?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Andrew Summer D2 9
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Well, I haven't got myself into painting even now.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Andrew Summer D2 10
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: But he always keep reminding me to study deeper into the detail, and all the things will come up on the paper by themselves.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Andrew Summer D2 11
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Now, I could even remember the color of every pieces of feather on its wing.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Andrew Summer D2 12
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: I guess it's time to pick up the brush and start to paint. There's lot of things to talk but I gotta prepare for the night duty. See ya around. Bye.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Andrew Summer D2 13
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: See you then, bye.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Andrew Summer D3 0
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Hi, Andrew. You didn't draw a bird today?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Andrew Summer D3 1
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: I did, finished it a while ago. What is it?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Andrew Summer D3 2
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: I've been wondering, what brings you to draw a bird everyday?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Andrew Summer D3 3
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: You mean motivation? I guess it's because when I show my drawing, it amazed people, and my father sees a potential in that.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Andrew Summer D3 4
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: He believes that I shoud be better off with drawing, rather than going out and hunting birds everyday.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Andrew Summer D3 5
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: But how is that any better when you still work everyday?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Andrew Summer D3 6
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Well, even I love what I am doing, it used to be that not everytime that I could bring myself to draw.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Andrew Summer D3 7
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: But it was when people talks about my drawing, I always felt I had left something for this world.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Andrew Summer D3 8
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: It's really hard to explain, but I can feel that at least I am going towards somewhere, unlike my father, who just keep hunting birds everyday.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Andrew Summer D3 9
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: I certainly know how he felt, but I couldn't help but wonder what keeps him doing it everyday.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Andrew Summer D3 10
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: I guess, if he didn't work, he couldn't feed?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Andrew Summer D3 11
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: I know, but he could have done something else then.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Andrew Summer D3 12
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: But what would it be then?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Andrew Summer D3 13
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Hm...You are right, the man can only stick to what he already knows to take care of his family.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Andrew Summer D3 14
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: I guess even if it was the most boring things in the world, we could do it for someone we care, and it could be why he insisted me to draw.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Andrew Summer D3 15
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: He wanted me to grow better than what he is. I've never had this much talk before. And by the way, I have a drawing of you too, as a gratitude.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Andrew Summer D3 16
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Really!?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Andrew Summer D3 17
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: And........here, it's yours. Keep it.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Andrew Summer D3 18
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Great! Thanks, Andrew.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Andrew Summer E0 0
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: See you later.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry D0 0
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Hey there, boy. How was the meal?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry D0 1
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: It's great, not like anything I imagined it to be.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry D0 2
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Hoho, I'm glad to hear that.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry D0 4
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Oh, sorry. That was out of habit. My name's Tim, I'm usually on cook duty.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry D0 5
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Wow, you're really good!

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry D0 6
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Haha, thanks. A happy diner makes a happy chef.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry D1 0
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Hey, Tim.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry D1 1
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Oh, hello there. Something's up?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry D1 2
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: I just wanna know secret to your cooking.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry D1 3
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Haha, it's nothing much. I'm just following the recipe.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry D1 4
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: That can't be all there is to it. It's too good for a textbook things.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry D1 5
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: You think so?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry D1 6
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Serious.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry D1 7
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Hmm... All I can think of is care and experience.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry D1 8
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Experience, I understand. But care?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry D1 9
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: To make a good food, you need to keep your diner in mind.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry D1 10
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Think about what kind of person they are, what they need and what they want.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry D1 11
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: If you got that figured out, it's easy to adjust the taste to suit the eater. Something along that line, I suppose.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry D1 12
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Wow... I never know cooking can be this delicate..

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry D1 13
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Haha, now you know. Why not try cooking with me some time?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry D1 14
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Sure, if I get the chance, I'd love to.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry D2 0
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Hello Tim, can I ask something?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry D2 1
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Sure, what do you want to know?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry D2 2
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: You often called people 'diner', were you some sort of master chef?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry D2 3
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Such flattery. I'm just an ordinary chef.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry D2 4
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: But you're so good at it that I thought you were some high class people.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry D2 5
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: People like that won't be cooking food here, you know.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry D2 6
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Oh.. right.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry D2 7
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: I used to own a restaurant back home so that gave me a lot of experience.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry D2 8
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: I see. Then why did you enlisted?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry D2 9
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Hmm....I guess it's because my family is good enough to handle the restaurant themselves.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry D2 10
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: I wanted to feed people who need it and looking at the poor soldiers being malnourished is just sad.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry D2 11
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: That's.... a pretty weird reason.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry D2 12
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: I know, right? But it's how I actually felt. I feel like I'm obligated to do something for our country too.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry D2 13
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Well, no matter the reason, we need to thank you for making us good food to keep us going.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry D2 14
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: No problem. I'm happy that you all like it.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry D3 0
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Hey, anything you'd like to request?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry D3 1
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Hm? What?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry D3 2
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Is there anything special you want to eat?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry D3 3
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Uh, why? Something's the matter?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry D3 4
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Well, cooking the same meal days in and out is gonna make me rusty.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry D3 5
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Figured I should try something else as well.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry D3 6
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Even if you ask me, I don't think we have anything else other than standard ingredients...

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry D3 7
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Shh.. Don't underestimate a chef.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry D3 8
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: ....Alright. I'll think of something.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry D3 9
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Cool, let me know what you've got.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry D4 0
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: How was the special dish?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry D4 3
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: I'm speechless. It's too good. What the hell.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry D4 4
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Whew, I almost had a heartattack there. I thought you didn't like it.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry D4 5
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: How did you make something like that? You actually have a secret ingredients, right?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry D4 6
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Hehe, not really.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry D4 7
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: So it must be in how you cook, right?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry D4 8
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Now that's a trade secret.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry D4 9
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Awww.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry D4 10
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: If you want to know, or have another dish like that, come to my restaurant after this war. I'll tell you then. Promise.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry D4 11
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: I'll made sure to go!

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Tim Berry E0 0
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Now that you've eaten a good food, make sure to get a good rest too.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Harper Scott D0 0
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: I knew it from the start that this is gonna happened...

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Harper Scott D0 1
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: You mean that we staying here? The communication was cut off...

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Harper Scott D0 2
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: No, I mean the war! I knew it that the war is unavoidable.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Harper Scott D0 3
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: How come did you know it?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Harper Scott D0 4
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Well, something were better left unsaid. Something that the books won't even let you know.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Harper Scott D0 5
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Can you tell me about it? I'm getting confused here.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Harper Scott D0 6
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Well then, if you really wanted to know about them, by the way, my name is Harper. I'll talk to you later.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Harper Scott D0 7
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Gotta go now. Bye.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Harper Scott D0 8
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Bye...?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Harper Scott D1 0
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: It's you again, young boy.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Harper Scott D1 1
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Harper, about what you told me yesterday. Now, I wonder why there's a war at all?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Harper Scott D1 2
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: So, you wanted me to tell you? Please keep it a secret. I don't want people to hear it.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Harper Scott D1 3
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Alright, then.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Harper Scott D1 4
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Here is what it is, the government said that we will fight for nations, freedom, and liberty.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Harper Scott D1 5
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: They told young men that they are fighting for good when the truth is they just want a foreign soil.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Harper Scott D1 5
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Is it true!? That's horrible!

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Harper Scott D1 6
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Well, it's a political game. A dirty adult business, and they sent young children like you here, dying for their causes.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Harper Scott D1 7
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: I don't know...I've never think of this before, let alone the thought of dying...

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Harper Scott D1 8
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: But what you told me seems to be very interesting...

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Harper Scott D1 9
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Hm...I'll tatk to you about it on the other day then. I need to go now, and keep this a secret. Bye

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Harper Scott D1 10
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Okay...bye.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Harper Scott D2 0
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Hello there, young boy.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Harper Scott D2 1
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Hi, Harper.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Harper Scott D2 2
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: About what you told me yesterday. You don't feel like you are dying for anything?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Harper Scott D2 3
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Well, I do

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Harper Scott D2 4
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: But you seem to be working so hard in here, even knowing that somebody else sent you here?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Harper Scott D2 5
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: No, but....seeing everyone besides me struggling, I can't help but to work hard to get through this.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Harper Scott D2 6
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: And It makes me glad that we could get to live another day.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Harper Scott D2 7
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Even knowing that someone else sent you here out of their own selfishness?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Harper Scott D2 8
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Hmmm...I don't even know who they are that you are talking about. But all I know is that the only way we can survive is to fight...

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Harper Scott D2 9
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: I see...seeing how you still keep up with this spirit makes me wonder...I'll talk to you on the other day, I need to go now. Bye.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Harper Scott D2 10
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Okay. Bye.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Harper Scott D3 0
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Hi, boy.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Harper Scott D3 1
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Hi, Harper. Yesterday you mentioned something...What was it about?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Harper Scott D3 2
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Well, to tell you the truth, I was a university student before being drafted to the army.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Harper Scott D3 3
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: I used to believed that the government was corrupted, but all the thought or ideal become meaningless here.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Harper Scott D3 4
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: On a battlefield, young men were killing each other not for what they believe, but just to be alive and see another day.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Harper Scott D3 5
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: It might sounds dumb, but...this place taught me that nothing should ever come to this.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Harper Scott D3 6
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Why did you think like that?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Harper Scott D3 7
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Just look over the trenches, these people there, they could have enjoyed a dinner with their family.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Harper Scott D3 8
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: But here they are, stinking corpses littered just over the trench.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Harper Scott D3 9
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Just a thought of not being one of them is already enough to comfort me and makes me valued every second I got to breath.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Harper Scott D3 10
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: I wish everyone nothing more than just...to be happy.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Harper Scott D3 11
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Hmmm....you sounds really weird today.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Harper Scott D3 12
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Well, you don't need to understand all of them yet. Let's say that we will make it through and survive the war when it's over.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Harper Scott D3 13
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Sounds good?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Harper Scott D3 14
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Sure...

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Harper Scott D3 15
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Hope we could meet again when the war is over.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Harper Scott E0 0
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Take care, young boy.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Dwayne Manning D0 0
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Hi there, My name is Dwayne, young lad.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Dwayne Manning D0 1
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Hi. What are you doing, mister?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Dwayne Manning D0 2
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: I'm writing a poem.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Dwayne Manning D0 3
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: A poem? What is it about?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Dwayne Manning D0 4
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: I'm still thinking. Maybe about an adventure of ...a knight....

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Dwayne Manning D0 5
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: WOW! WHAT'S NEXT THEN!?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Dwayne Manning D0 6
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Well, I still haven't come up with anything concrete yet. Something about glory and honor, I guess

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Dwayne Manning D0 7
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Hm, I have not read a poem before. So, you are going to write about an adventure?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Dwayne Manning D0 8
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Hm...Actually, I just wanted something to write out something....compelling to read, but I haven't figure out what to write.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Dwayne Manning D0 9
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: I see, maybe something fun?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Dwayne Manning D0 10
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: But what makes it "fun" then?...I'm gotta get my stuff ready for the night duty. Take care.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Dwayne Manning D0 11
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Okay, bye.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Dwayne Manning D1 0
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: What is it, young lad?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Dwayne Manning D1 1
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: About the topics the day before, you said you are trying to figure out what "fun" mean?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Dwayne Manning D1 2
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Well, what do you think 'fun' mean when you said that?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Dwayne Manning D1 3
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: I just found it strange for someone to ask that question...but I think running around is already fun for me.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Dwayne Manning D1 4
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Well, not here of course. It's too....

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Dwayne Manning D1 5
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Too thrilling to be fun?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Dwayne Manning D1 6
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: I guess you can call it that. It just, feels too much here.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Dwayne Manning D1 7
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Hm...it's not about thrilling things that make it fun, I suppose.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Dwayne Manning D1 8
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: But I like it right now, it's all quiet, and I could walk around freely as much as I could, as long as it is not outside.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Dwayne Manning D1 9
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Ah...I think I'm getting an idea now, but...well, I still have not come up with anything yet.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Dwayne Manning D1 10
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: But talking to you really give me some idea. Thanks for that.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Dwayne Manning D1 11
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Let's talk another day. Gotta prepare for the night duty now. Take care.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Dwayne Manning D1 12
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Bye.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Dwayne Manning D2 1
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: You look quiet today, Dwayne. You still can't come up with what to write?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Dwayne Manning D2 2
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Yeah,. It's been a while now, but...

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Dwayne Manning D2 3
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: I saw a guy, probably same age as me,

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Dwayne Manning D2 4
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: he keeps running and running, towards the trench.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Dwayne Manning D2 5
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: He could be dreaming about a meal he's going to have tonight, or even going back home but then...

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Dwayne Manning D2 6
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: He was strucked by a bullet, and just that...

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Dwayne Manning D2 7
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: ...you don't have to be sorry for him. It's just the way things are here...

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Dwayne Manning D2 8
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: But at least, I'm glad that I got to nothing to worry about right now.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Dwayne Manning D2 9
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: You are right, I should be thankful that we are still alive, no matter what we have been through.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Dwayne Manning D2 10
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: But I gotta go now, for a night duty.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Dwayne Manning D2 11
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Okay, bye.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Dwayne Manning D3 0
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Hi, young boy.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Dwayne Manning D3 1
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Hi, Dwayne. You looked so cheerful today.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Dwayne Manning D3 2
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Of course I do. I already have my poem filled up the pages now.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Dwayne Manning D3 3
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Can you read me a part of it?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Dwayne Manning D3 4
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: It's not finished yet, but I can tell you what's it about...

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Dwayne Manning D3 5
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Really!? Tell me, tell me, tell me.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Dwayne Manning D3 6
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Hold your horse, boy. So, here we go...It's in the middle of a war,

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Dwayne Manning D3 7
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: but it's about a boy...

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Dwayne Manning D3 8
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: A BOY!?

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Dwayne Manning D3 9
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Yes, among a band of soldiers, there was a boy who stood out from the others...

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Dwayne Manning D3 10
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Though he is too small to fight, he did everything he could to help his comrades who is in need...

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Dwayne Manning D3 11
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Because of his unrelenting courage, it gives everyone a hope to make it through the darkness.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Dwayne Manning D3 12
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: That's pretty much it. I'm planning to print it on a book after the war, and I will give you one for free.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Dwayne Manning D3 13
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Wow, that's really cool. Thanks!

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Dwayne Manning D3 14
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Oh yes, the night duty, I gotta go now, See ya later.

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Dwayne Manning D3 15
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: See ya!

Dialogue.name: Pvt. Dwayne Manning E0 0
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Take care.

Dialogue.name: Lt. Henry Mattis D0 0
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Sir...

Dialogue.name: Lt. Henry Mattis D0 1
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Oh, no need to call me sir. Though I am an officer, but I'd prefer to keep things easy.

Dialogue.name: Lt. Henry Mattis D0 2
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: You can call me Henry.
