Dialogue.name: Lt. Henry Mattis D0 3
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Yes, Henry. I wonder what's that hanging there on you?

Dialogue.name: Lt. Henry Mattis D0 4
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Oh, it's a camera, for taking pictures.You can capture what you see here to show other fellows back home.

Dialogue.name: Lt. Henry Mattis D0 5
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Really!? That's cool!

Dialogue.name: Lt. Henry Mattis D0 6
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: And maybe someday, the picture could be with someone else in the far future too!

Dialogue.name: Lt. Henry Mattis D0 7
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: That's AMAZING!

Dialogue.name: Lt. Henry Mattis D0 8
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Oh, by the way, I need to go now. It's nice to talk to you.

Dialogue.name: Lt. Henry Mattis D1 0
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Hi Henry. Your camera thingy is really amazing! I wonder where did you get it from?

Dialogue.name: Lt. Henry Mattis D1 1
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: I got it from my family. My father brought me as a birthday gift. It was one of the best thing I got from him.

Dialogue.name: Lt. Henry Mattis D1 2
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Your father must be a very kind man.

Dialogue.name: Lt. Henry Mattis D1 3
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: He sure was. But he made me join the army against my wish.

Dialogue.name: Lt. Henry Mattis D1 4
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Why was that?

Dialogue.name: Lt. Henry Mattis D1 5
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Well, I was about to join the Navy, but it turns out I was unfit for them.

Dialogue.name: Lt. Henry Mattis D1 6
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: So my father made made me join the Army. He even bribed the recuiting officer and made me a cadet.

Dialogue.name: Lt. Henry Mattis D1 7
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: I guess he did everything to make me join the war.

Dialogue.name: Lt. Henry Mattis D1 8
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Let's keep this topic for other day. I need to go now.

Dialogue.name: Lt. Henry Mattis D1 9
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Ok, Henry. Bye.

Dialogue.name: Lt. Henry Mattis D2 0
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Hi, Henry. You look quiet today. What's the matter?

Dialogue.name: Lt. Henry Mattis D2 1
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Well, This place was much worse than I thought it would be.

Dialogue.name: Lt. Henry Mattis D2 2
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: There's no picture of glory or honor here like what they said back home. There's only suffering and death...

Dialogue.name: Lt. Henry Mattis D2 3
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: My father thought that he would be proud if he had a son in the military, but I had failed his expectation here.

Dialogue.name: Lt. Henry Mattis D2 4
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: It's just too much for me to bear the lives of other people. I'm not ready to handle it if anything happened to them.

Dialogue.name: Lt. Henry Mattis D2 5
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Hm...at least we could still be useful to one another, I guess.

Dialogue.name: Lt. Henry Mattis D2 6
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: You're right. Even a young boy like you still helped us a lot in here. I'll keep your words in mind. Thanks.

Dialogue.name: Lt. Henry Mattis D2 7
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Sure, you're welcome.

Dialogue.name: Lt. Henry Mattis D3 0
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: You sure looks fine today, Henry.

Dialogue.name: Lt. Henry Mattis D3 1
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Yeah. I've been thinking about what you've said.

Dialogue.name: Lt. Henry Mattis D3 2
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: The thing is, I never wanted to join the military in the first place.

Dialogue.name: Lt. Henry Mattis D3 3
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: But I thought that you wanted to be in the Navy?

Dialogue.name: Lt. Henry Mattis D3 4
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Well, what I really want is just being anywhere outside and afar.

Dialogue.name: Lt. Henry Mattis D3 5
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: My familiy, we already have everything that money could buy. But it wasn't not fulfilling.

Dialogue.name: Lt. Henry Mattis D3 6
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: I decided that I must go out to somewhere before I could find out what's my life is gonna be, and I think I have figured it out now.

Dialogue.name: Lt. Henry Mattis D3 7
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: I'm going to be a photographer, recording everywhere I have been and made it into a book!

Dialogue.name: Lt. Henry Mattis D3 8
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Wow, that's really cool!

Dialogue.name: Lt. Henry Mattis D3 9
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: By the way, wanna take a picture?

Dialogue.name: Lt. Henry Mattis D3 10
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Sure!

Dialogue.name: Lt. Henry Mattis D3 11
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Okay Let me set up the camera. Say cheese.

Dialogue.name: Lt. Henry Mattis D3 12
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: CHEESE!

Dialogue.name: Lt. Henry Mattis D3 13
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: *SNAP*

Dialogue.name: Lt. Henry Mattis D3 14
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Can I see it?

Dialogue.name: Lt. Henry Mattis D3 15
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Well, it will take me a while to get the picture.

Dialogue.name: Lt. Henry Mattis D3 16
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: But don't be sad, I'll give it to you after the war. I'm sure you will be delighted.

Dialogue.name: Lt. Henry Mattis E0 0
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: See you later, take care.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Becker Samson D0 0
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Hah...

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Becker Samson D0 5
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Uh, are you alright, sir?

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Becker Samson D0 6
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: ...Hmm? Nah, it's nothing. Don't mind me.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Becker Samson D0 7
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Uh... understood.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Becker Samson D1 0
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Sir, are you really okay? You're sighing a lot.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Becker Samson D1 1
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Huh? Oh, uh, sorry about that, private.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Becker Samson D1 2
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: You don't have to apologize, sir. Is something troubling you?

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Becker Samson D1 3
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Well, 'something' is quite and understatement...

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Becker Samson D1 5
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Never mind. I'll have to leave now.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Becker Samson D1 6
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Ah...

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Becker Samson D2 0
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Private. Come here for a sec.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Becker Samson D2 1
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Sir.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Becker Samson D2 2
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Hi. Thank you for worrying about me the other day.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Becker Samson D2 3
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: No problem, sir...

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Becker Samson D2 4
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Becker. Becker Samson.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Becker Samson D2 5
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Noted. Anything I can help you with?

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Becker Samson D2 6
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Nah, I just need to vent. This war has been taking a toll on me.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Becker Samson D2 7
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: That sound... harsh.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Becker Samson D2 8
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Yeah, well.. Being outnumbered and outgunned ain't fun.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Becker Samson D2 9
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: We're treading on a tightrope here and HQ didn't even bother sending reinforcement.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Becker Samson D2 10
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Guess we're going to die. Hah..

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Becker Samson D2 11
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Don't lose hope, sir. We will fight to the very end. I'm sure things will work out.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Becker Samson D2 13
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Yeah. Keep up that optimisim. We need more people like you around.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Becker Samson D3 0
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Sir.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Becker Samson D3 1
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Hello there, priv. At ease.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Becker Samson D3 2
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Thank you, sir. How are you feeling today?

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Becker Samson D3 3
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Same thing, different day. Things just don't look any better at all.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Becker Samson D3 4
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: I don't agree, sir. We survived another day, I think that's a good sign for the better.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Becker Samson D3 5
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Heh, if only things were that easy. In the end, we're still outnumbered.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Becker Samson D3 6
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: .... I can't deny that.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Becker Samson D3 7
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Listen to me, kiddo. I'm sure we're all going to die here.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Becker Samson D3 8
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Or worse, we're captured and then tortured for infos that we don't even know.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Becker Samson D3 9
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: If you see things are looking bad, remember to spare a bullet for yourself, alright?

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Becker Samson D4 0
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Hey, there, so-- private.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Becker Samson D4 1
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: ...Son?

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Becker Samson D4 2
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: It's a slip of tongue, forget it.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Becker Samson D4 6
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: ....This is getting awkward.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Becker Samson D4 8
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Alright, alright. You just reminded me of my son, that's all.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Becker Samson D4 9
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: I didn't know you have a son, is he in other squad?

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Becker Samson D4 10
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: .... I don't know. I haven't heard about him in years.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Becker Samson D4 11
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Heard about him?

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Becker Samson D4 12
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: He was a soldier, just like us. But he was captured by the enemy...

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Becker Samson D4 13
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: ...I'm sorry to hear that, sir..

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Becker Samson D4 14
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: Mm.... I don't want you to have to go through the things he did, private.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Becker Samson D4 15
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: You've been real good to be. That's why I suggested you to always spare a bullet for yourself.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Becker Samson D4 16
Dialogue.Speaker: PLAYER
Dialogue.Text: Sir....

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Becker Samson D4 17
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: You don't have to try to convince me. It's already too late. You take care of yourself.

Dialogue.name: Sgt. Becker Samson E0 0
Dialogue.Speaker: NPC
Dialogue.Text: This is absolutely ridiculous...
